extracted_news.title: Binance Futures to Cease Support for USDP as Cross Collateral, Introduces FDUSD
extracted_news.body: Starting from 17:00 on March 8, 2024, Binance Futures will support FDUSD as a joint margin asset, and will stop supporting USDP as a joint margin asset at 14:00 on March 14, 2024 (Beijing time). Due to this change, the transfer limit of USDP under the joint margin mode has been updated to zero. After 14:00 on March 14, 2024, any remaining USDP balance in the U-based contract wallet will be automatically converted to USDT at a ratio of 1:1, which may take approximately 24 hours and may not be displayed in the transaction history.

extracted_news.title: Don’t let DeFi collapse on shaky foundations
extracted_news.body: Opinion: What we’ve built so far can be compared to a collection of shiny skyscrapers, each project adrift on its own island of liquidity.

According to SlowMist monitoring, the attackers of Bitbrowser, which is often used by airdrop hunters, have transferred 236.27 ETH to the mixer eXch, worth about 386,000 US dollars, accounting for 70.6% of the total stolen funds. Previously, Bitbrowser issued a notice saying that…

Alex, the founder of zkSync, proposed a new governance solution: L1 Fork as the Court of Final Appeal and a hierarchical system of onchain courts similar to the real-world judiciary with a standard ERC interface for it. zkSync will fund such research. Read more…

A Chinese court ruled that a Filecoin mining case violated the principles of green development and social and public interests, so the contract was invalid. At present, most civil contracts involving cryptocurrency and mining are not recognized by Chinese courts and ruled…

extracted_news.title: Asia's weekly TOP10 crypto news (Aug 28 to Sep 3)
extracted_news.body: China: An article published in the People's Court Daily argues that virtual currencies should be recognized as legitimate assets and protected unless used for illegal activities. In a separate case, a court in Wuhan declared a virtual currency mining contract invalid. Hong Kong: HashKey Exchange opens retail trading and plans to introduce HKD trading pairs in the future. SEBA Bank receives preliminary approval from the SFC to engage in securities trading. ZA Bank becomes the first settlement bank for HashKey Exchange. South Korea: Financial authorities will require exchanges to establish reserves to compensate users for losses. Arrest warrants for individuals involved in cryptocurrency listing bribery are rejected. Delio discloses platform deposits and estimated loss rate. Japan: The FSA releases financial policy guidelines for the 2023 fiscal year, aiming to achieve a digital society. Binance Japan announces market strategy to increase the number of tradable cryptocurrencies. India: OKX plans to enter India and recruit local staff. CoinSwitch lays off employees from the customer support team. Binance considers exiting the Russian market. Other News: Electricite Du Laos stops providing electricity to cryptocurrency mining operations. Uzbekistan develops regulations for cryptocurrency miner registration and mining pool operations. Turkish Lira stablecoin becomes the second-largest non-USD stablecoin. Oman invests nearly $800 million in cryptocurrency mining operations.

#Autumn is sneaking into the northern hemisphere. Do you feel it? 🍂

#HangoutwithKuCoin

extracted_news.body: China: An article published in the People's Court Daily argues that virtual currencies should be recognized as legitimate assets and protected unless used for illegal activities. SEBA Bank receives preliminary approval from the SFC to engage in securities trading. ZA Bank becomes the first settlement bank for HashKey Exchange. South Korea: Financial authorities will require exchanges to establish reserves to compensate users for losses. Arrest warrants for individuals involved in cryptocurrency listing bribery are rejected. Delio discloses platform deposits and estimated loss rate. Japan: The FSA releases financial policy guidelines for the 2023 fiscal year, aiming to achieve a digital society. Binance Japan announces market strategy to increase the number of tradable cryptocurrencies. India: OKX plans to enter India and recruit local staff. CoinSwitch lays off employees from the customer support team. Binance considers exiting the Russian market. Other News: Electricite Du Laos stops providing electricity to cryptocurrency mining operations. Uzbekistan develops regulations for cryptocurrency miner registration and mining pool operations. Turkish Lira stablecoin becomes the second-largest non-USD stablecoin. Oman invests nearly $800 million in cryptocurrency mining operations.

extracted_news.title: Binance Futures to Cease Support for USDP as Cross Collateral, Introduces FDUSD
extracted_news.body: Starting from 17:00 on March 8, 2024, Binance Futures will support FDUSD as a joint margin asset, and will stop supporting USDP as a joint margin asset at 14:00 on March 14, 2024 (Beijing time). Due to this change, the transfer limit of USDP under the joint margin mode has been updated to zero. After 14:00 on March 14, 2024, any remaining USDP balance in the U-based contract wallet will be automatically converted to USDT at a ratio of 1:1, which may take approximately 24 hours and may not be displayed in the transaction history.

extracted_news.title: Asia's weekly TOP10 crypto news (Aug 28 to Sep 3)
extracted_news.body: China: An article published in the People's Court Daily argues that virtual currencies should be recognized as legitimate assets and protected unless used for illegal activities. In a separate case, a court in Wuhan declared a virtual currency mining contract invalid. Hong Kong: HashKey Exchange opens retail trading and plans to introduce HKD trading pairs in the future. SEBA Bank receives preliminary approval from the SFC to engage in securities trading. ZA Bank becomes the first settlement bank for HashKey Exchange. South Korea: Financial authorities will require exchanges to establish reserves to compensate users for losses. Arrest warrants for individuals involved in cryptocurrency listing bribery are rejected. Delio discloses platform deposits and estimated loss rate. Japan: The FSA releases financial policy guidelines for the 2023 fiscal year, aiming to achieve a digital society. Binance Japan announces market strategy to increase the number of tradable cryptocurrencies. India: OKX plans to enter India and recruit local staff. CoinSwitch lays off employees from the customer support team. Binance considers exiting the Russian market. Other News: Electricite Du Laos stops providing electricity to cryptocurrency mining operations. Uzbekistan develops regulations for cryptocurrency miner registration and mining pool operations. Turkish Lira stablecoin becomes the second-largest non-USD stablecoin. Oman invests nearly $800 million in cryptocurrency mining operations.

#Autumn is sneaking into the northern hemisphere. Do you feel it? 🍂

extracted_news.title: Asia's weekly TOP10 crypto news (Aug 28 to Sep 3)
extracted_news.body: China: An article published in the People's Court Daily argues that virtual currencies should be recognized as legitimate assets and protected unless used for illegal activities. In a separate case, a court in Wuhan declared a virtual currency mining contract invalid. Hong Kong: HashKey Exchange opens retail trading and plans to introduce HKD trading pairs in the future. SEBA Bank receives preliminary approval from the SFC to engage in securities trading. ZA Bank becomes the first settlement bank for HashKey Exchange. South Korea: Financial authorities will require exchanges to establish reserves to compensate users for losses. Arrest warrants for individuals involved in cryptocurrency listing bribery are rejected. Delio discloses platform deposits and estimated loss rate. Japan: The FSA releases financial policy guidelines for the 2023 fiscal year, aiming to achieve a digital society. Binance Japan announces market strategy to increase the number of tradable cryptocurrencies. India: OKX plans to enter India and recruit local staff. CoinSwitch lays off employees from the customer support team. Binance considers exiting the Russian market. Other News: Electricite Du Laos stops providing electricity to cryptocurrency mining operations. Uzbekistan develops regulations for cryptocurrency miner registration and mining pool operations. Turkish Lira stablecoin becomes the second-largest non-USD stablecoin. Oman invests nearly $800 million in cryptocurrency mining operations.

extracted_news.title: Asia's weekly TOP10 crypto news (Aug 28 to Sep 3)
extracted_news.body: China: An article published in the People's Court Daily argues that virtual currencies should be recognized as legitimate assets and protected unless used for illegal activities. In a separate case, a court in Wuhan declared a virtual currency mining contract invalid. Hong Kong: HashKey Exchange opens retail trading and plans to introduce HKD trading pairs in the future. SEBA Bank receives preliminary approval from the SFC to engage in securities trading. ZA Bank becomes the first settlement bank for HashKey Exchange. South Korea: Financial authorities will require exchanges to establish reserves to compensate users for losses. Arrest warrants for individuals involved in cryptocurrency listing bribery are rejected. Delio discloses platform deposits and estimated loss rate. Japan: The FSA releases financial policy guidelines for the 2023 fiscal year, aiming to achieve a digital society. Binance Japan announces market strategy to increase the number of tradable cryptocurrencies. India: OKX plans to enter India and recruit local staff. CoinSwitch lays off employees from the customer support team. Binance considers exiting the Russian market. Other News: Electricite Du Laos stops providing electricity to cryptocurrency mining operations. Uzbekistan develops regulations for cryptocurrency miner registration and mining pool operations. Turkish Lira stablecoin becomes the second-largest non-USD stablecoin. Oman invests nearly $800 million in cryptocurrency mining operations.

extracted_news.body: Starting from 17:00 on March 8, 2024, Binance Futures will support FDUSD as a joint margin asset, and will stop supporting USDP as a joint margin asset at 14:00 on March 14, 2024 (Beijing time). extracted_news.title: Asia's weekly TOP10 crypto news (Aug 28 to Sep 3)
extracted_news.body: China: An article published in the People's Court Daily argues that virtual currencies should be recognized as legitimate assets and protected unless used for illegal activities. In a separate case, a court in Wuhan declared a virtual currency mining contract invalid. Hong Kong: HashKey Exchange opens retail trading and plans to introduce HKD trading pairs in the future. SEBA Bank receives preliminary approval from the SFC to engage in securities trading. ZA Bank becomes the first settlement bank for HashKey Exchange. South Korea: Financial authorities will require exchanges to establish reserves to compensate users for losses. Arrest warrants for individuals involved in cryptocurrency listing bribery are rejected. Delio discloses platform deposits and estimated loss rate. Japan: The FSA releases financial policy guidelines for the 2023 fiscal year, aiming to achieve a digital society. Binance Japan announces market strategy to increase the number of tradable cryptocurrencies. India: OKX plans to enter India and recruit local staff. CoinSwitch lays off employees from the customer support team. Binance considers exiting the Russian market. Other News: Electricite Du Laos stops providing electricity to cryptocurrency mining operations. Uzbekistan develops regulations for cryptocurrency miner registration and mining pool operations. Turkish Lira stablecoin becomes the second-largest non-USD stablecoin. Oman invests nearly $800 million in cryptocurrency mining operations.

extracted_news.title: Binance Futures to Cease Support for USDP as Cross Collateral, Introduces FDUSD
extracted_news.body: Starting from 17:00 on March 8, 2024, Binance Futures will support FDUSD as a joint margin asset, and will stop supporting USDP as a joint margin asset at 14:00 on March 14, 2024 (Beijing time). Due to this change, the transfer limit of USDP under the joint margin mode has been updated to zero. After 14:00 on March 14, 2024, any remaining USDP balance in the U-based contract wallet will be automatically converted to USDT at a ratio of 1:1, which may take approximately 24 hours and may not be displayed in the transaction history.

extracted_news.title: Asia's weekly TOP10 crypto news (Aug 28 to Sep 3)
extracted_news.body: China: An article published in the People's Court Daily argues that virtual currencies should be recognized as legitimate assets and protected unless used for illegal activities. In a separate case, a court in Wuhan declared a virtual currency mining contract invalid. Hong Kong: HashKey Exchange opens retail trading and plans to introduce HKD trading pairs in the future. SEBA Bank receives preliminary approval from the SFC to engage in securities trading. ZA Bank becomes the first settlement bank for HashKey Exchange. South Korea: Financial authorities will require exchanges to establish reserves to compensate users for losses. Arrest warrants for individuals involved in cryptocurrency listing bribery are rejected. Delio discloses platform deposits and estimated loss rate. Japan: The FSA releases financial policy guidelines for the 2023 fiscal year, aiming to achieve a digital society. Binance Japan announces market strategy to increase the number of tradable cryptocurrencies. India: OKX plans to enter India and recruit local staff. CoinSwitch lays off employees from the customer support team. Binance considers exiting the Russian market. Other News: Electricite Du Laos stops providing electricity to cryptocurrency mining operations. Uzbekistan develops regulations for cryptocurrency miner registration and mining pool operations. Turkish Lira stablecoin becomes the second-largest non-USD stablecoin. Oman invests nearly $800 million in cryptocurrency mining operations.

extracted_news.title: Binance Futures to Cease Support for USDP as Cross Collateral, Introduces FDUSD
extracted_news.body: Starting from 17:00 on March 8, 2024, Binance Futures will support FDUSD as a joint margin asset, and will stop supporting USDP as a joint margin asset at 14:00 on March 14, 2024 (Beijing time). Due to this change, the transfer limit of USDP under the joint margin mode has been updated to zero. After 14:00 on March 14, 2024, any remaining USDP balance in the U-based contract wallet will be automatically converted to USDT at a ratio of 1:1, which may take approximately 24 hours and may not be displayed in the transaction history.

extracted_news.title: Asia's weekly TOP10 crypto news (Aug 28 to Sep 3)
extracted_news.body: China: An article published in the People's Court Daily argues that virtual currencies should be recognized as legitimate assets and protected unless used for illegal activities. In a separate case, a court in Wuhan declared a virtual currency mining contract invalid. Hong Kong: HashKey Exchange opens retail trading and plans to introduce HKD trading pairs in the future. SEBA Bank receives preliminary approval from the SFC to engage in securities trading. ZA Bank becomes the first settlement bank for HashKey Exchange. South Korea: Financial authorities will require exchanges to establish reserves to compensate users for losses. Arrest warrants for individuals involved in cryptocurrency listing bribery are rejected. Delio discloses platform deposits and estimated loss rate. Japan: The FSA releases financial policy guidelines for the 2023 fiscal year, aiming to achieve a digital society. Binance Japan announces market strategy to increase the number of tradable cryptocurrencies. India: OKX plans to enter India and recruit local staff. CoinSwitch lays off employees from the customer support team. Binance considers exiting the Russian market. Other News: Electricite Du Laos stops providing electricity to cryptocurrency mining operations. Uzbekistan develops regulations for cryptocurrency miner registration and mining pool operations. Turkish Lira stablecoin becomes the second-largest non-USD stablecoin. Oman invests nearly $800 million in cryptocurrency mining operations.

#Autumn is sneaking into the northern hemisphere. Do you feel it? 🍂

There is also a notable increase in investor interest and funding for crypto startups, indicating confidence in the long-term viability of the industry. extracted_news.title: Binance Futures to Cease Support for USDP as Cross Collateral, Introduces FDUSD
extracted_news.body: Starting from 17:00 on March 8, 2024, Binance Futures will support FDUSD as a joint margin asset, and will stop supporting USDP as a joint margin asset at 14:00 on March 14, 2024 (Beijing time). Due to this change, the transfer limit of USDP under the joint margin mode has been updated to zero. After 14:00 on March 14, 2024, any remaining USDP balance in the U-based contract wallet will be automatically converted to USDT at a ratio of 1:1, which may take approximately 24 hours and may not be displayed in the transaction history.

extracted_news.title: Asia's weekly TOP10 crypto news (Aug 28 to Sep 3)
extracted_news.body: China: An article published in the People's Court Daily argues that virtual currencies should be recognized as legitimate assets and protected unless used for illegal activities. In a separate case, a court in Wuhan declared a virtual currency mining contract invalid. Hong Kong: HashKey Exchange opens retail trading and plans to introduce HKD trading pairs in the future. SEBA Bank receives preliminary approval from the SFC to engage in securities trading. ZA Bank becomes the first settlement bank for HashKey Exchange. South Korea: Financial authorities will require exchanges to establish reserves to compensate users for losses. Arrest warrants for individuals involved in cryptocurrency listing bribery are rejected. Delio discloses platform deposits and estimated loss rate. Japan: The FSA releases financial policy guidelines for the 2023 fiscal year, aiming to achieve a digital society. Binance Japan announces market strategy to increase the number of tradable cryptocurrencies. India: OKX plans to enter India and recruit local staff. CoinSwitch lays off employees from the customer support team. Binance considers exiting the Russian market. Other News: Electricite Du Laos stops providing electricity to cryptocurrency mining operations. Uzbekistan develops regulations for cryptocurrency miner registration and mining pool operations. Turkish Lira stablecoin becomes the second-largest non-USD stablecoin. Oman invests nearly $800 million in cryptocurrency mining operations.

#Autumn is sneaking into the northern hemisphere. Do you feel it? 🍂

#HangoutwithKuCoin

detailed_analysis.title: Binance Futures to Cease Support for USDP as Cross Collateral, Introduces FDUSD
detailed_analysis.body: Starting from 17:00 on March 8, 2024, Binance Futures will support FDUSD as a joint margin asset, and will stop supporting USDP as a joint margin asset at 14:00 on March 14, 2024 (Beijing time). Due to this change, the transfer limit of USDP under the joint margin mode has been updated to zero. After 14:00 on March 14, 2024, any remaining USDP balance in the U-based contract wallet will be automatically converted to USDT at a ratio of 1:1, which may take approximately 24 hours and may not be displayed in the transaction history.

extracted_news.title: Binance Futures to Cease Support for USDP as Cross Collateral, Introduces FDUSD
extracted_news.body: Starting from 17:00 on March 8, 2024, Binance Futures will support FDUSD as a joint margin asset, and will stop supporting USDP as a joint margin asset at 14:00 on March 14, 2024 (Beijing time). Due to this change, the transfer limit of USDP under the joint margin mode has been updated to zero. After 14:00 on March 14, 2024, any remaining USDP balance in the U-based contract wallet will be automatically converted to USDT at a ratio of 1:1, which may take approximately 24 hours and may not be displayed in the transaction history.

extracted_news.title: Asia's weekly TOP10 crypto news (Aug 28 to Sep 3)
extracted_news.body: China: An article published in the People's Court Daily argues that virtual currencies should be recognized as legitimate assets and protected unless used for illegal activities. In a separate case, a court in Wuhan declared a virtual currency mining contract invalid. Hong Kong: HashKey Exchange opens retail trading and plans to introduce HKD trading pairs in the future. SEBA Bank receives preliminary approval from the SFC to engage in securities trading. ZA Bank becomes the first settlement bank for HashKey Exchange. South Korea: Financial authorities will require exchanges to establish reserves to compensate users for losses. Arrest warrants for individuals involved in cryptocurrency listing bribery are rejected. Delio discloses platform deposits and estimated loss rate. Japan: The FSA releases financial policy guidelines for the 2023 fiscal year, aiming to achieve a digital society. Binance Japan announces market strategy to increase the number of tradable cryptocurrencies. India: OKX plans to enter India and recruit local staff. CoinSwitch lays off employees from the customer support team. Binance considers exiting the Russian market. Other News: Electricite Du Laos stops providing electricity to cryptocurrency mining operations. Uzbekistan develops regulations for cryptocurrency miner registration and mining pool operations. Turkish Lira stablecoin becomes the second-largest non-USD stablecoin. Oman invests nearly $800 million in cryptocurrency mining operations.

detailed_analysis.title: Asia's weekly TOP10 crypto news (Aug 28 to Sep 3)
detailed_analysis.body: China: An article published in the People's Court Daily argues that virtual currencies should be recognized as legitimate assets and protected unless used for illegal activities. In a separate case, a court in Wuhan declared a virtual currency mining contract invalid. Hong Kong: HashKey Exchange opens retail trading and plans to introduce HKD trading pairs in the future. SEBA Bank receives preliminary approval from the SFC to engage in securities trading. ZA Bank becomes the first settlement bank for HashKey Exchange. South Korea: Financial authorities will require exchanges to establish reserves to compensate users for losses. Arrest warrants for individuals involved in cryptocurrency listing bribery are rejected. Delio discloses platform deposits and estimated loss rate. Japan: The FSA releases financial policy guidelines for the 2023 fiscal year, aiming to achieve a digital society. Binance Japan announces market strategy to increase the number of tradable cryptocurrencies. India: OKX plans to enter India and recruit local staff. CoinSwitch lays off employees from the customer support team. Binance considers exiting the Russian market. Other News: Electricite Du Laos stops providing electricity to cryptocurrency mining operations. Uzbekistan develops regulations for cryptocurrency miner registration and mining pool operations. Turkish Lira stablecoin becomes the second-largest non-USD stablecoin. Oman invests nearly $800 million in cryptocurrency mining operations.

#Autumn is sneaking into the northern hemisphere. Do you feel it? 🍂

extracted_news.title: Binance Futures to Cease Support for USDP as Cross Collateral, Introduces FDUSD
extracted_news.body: Starting from 17:00 on March 8, 2024, Binance Futures will support FDUSD as a joint margin asset, and will stop supporting USDP as a joint margin asset at 14:00 on March 14, 2024 (Beijing time). Due to this change, the transfer limit of USDP under the joint margin mode has been updated to zero. After 14:00 on March 14, 2024, any remaining USDP balance in the U-based contract wallet will be automatically converted to USDT at a ratio of 1:1, which may take approximately 24 hours and may not be displayed in the transaction history.

Alex, the founder of zkSync, proposed a new governance solution: L1 Fork as the Court of Final Appeal and a hierarchical system of onchain courts similar to the real-world judiciary with a standard ERC interface for it. zkSync will fund such research. Read more…

A Chinese court ruled that a Filecoin mining case violated the principles of green development and social and public interests, so the contract was invalid. At present, most civil contracts involving cryptocurrency and mining are not recognized by Chinese courts and ruled…

detailed_analysis.title: Asia's weekly TOP10 crypto news (Aug 28 to Sep 3)
detailed_analysis.body: China: An article published in the People's Court Daily argues that virtual currencies should be recognized as legitimate assets and protected unless used for illegal activities. In a separate case, a court in Wuhan declared a virtual currency mining contract invalid. Hong Kong: HashKey Exchange opens retail trading and plans to introduce HKD trading pairs in the future. SEBA Bank receives preliminary approval from the SFC to engage in securities trading. ZA Bank becomes the first settlement bank for HashKey Exchange. South Korea: Financial authorities will require exchanges to establish reserves to compensate users for losses. Arrest warrants for individuals involved in cryptocurrency listing bribery are rejected. Delio discloses platform deposits and estimated loss rate. Japan: The FSA releases financial policy guidelines for the 2023 fiscal year, aiming to achieve a digital society. Binance Japan announces market strategy to increase the number of tradable cryptocurrencies. India: OKX plans to enter India and recruit local staff. CoinSwitch lays off employees from the customer support team. Binance considers exiting the Russian market. Other News: Electricite Du Laos stops providing electricity to cryptocurrency mining operations. Uzbekistan develops regulations for cryptocurrency miner registration and mining pool operations. Turkish Lira stablecoin becomes the second-largest non-USD stablecoin. Oman invests nearly $800 million in cryptocurrency mining operations.

#Autumn is sneaking into the northern hemisphere. Do you feel it? 🍂

extracted_news.title: Binance Futures to Cease Support for USDP as Cross Collateral, Introduces FDUSD
extracted_news.body: Starting from 17:00 on March 8, 2024, Binance Futures will support FDUSD as a joint margin asset, and will stop supporting USDP as a joint margin asset at 14:00 on March 14, 2024 (Beijing time). Due to this change, the transfer limit of USDP under the joint margin mode has been updated to zero. After 14:00 on March 14, 2024, any remaining USDP balance in the U-based contract wallet will be automatically converted to USDT at a ratio of 1:1, which may take approximately 24 hours and may not be displayed in the transaction history.

Alex, the founder of zkSync, proposed a new governance solution: L1 Fork as the Court of Final Appeal and a hierarchical system of onchain courts similar to the real-world judiciary with a standard ERC interface for it. zkSync will fund such research. Read more…

A Chinese court ruled that a Filecoin mining case violated the principles of green development and social and public interests, so the contract was invalid. At present, most civil contracts involving cryptocurrency and mining are not recognized by Chinese courts and ruled…

detailed_analysis.title: Asia's weekly TOP10 crypto news (Aug 28 to Sep 3)
detailed_analysis.body: China: An article published in the People's Court Daily argues that virtual currencies should be recognized as legitimate assets and protected unless used for illegal activities. In a separate case, a court in Wuhan declared a virtual currency mining contract invalid. Hong Kong: HashKey Exchange opens retail trading and plans to introduce HKD trading pairs in the future. SEBA Bank receives preliminary approval from the SFC to engage in securities trading. ZA Bank becomes the first settlement bank for HashKey Exchange. South Korea: Financial authorities will require exchanges to establish reserves to compensate users for losses. Arrest warrants for individuals involved in cryptocurrency listing bribery are rejected. Delio discloses platform deposits and estimated loss rate. Japan: The FSA releases financial policy guidelines for the 2023 fiscal year, aiming to achieve a digital society. Binance Japan announces market strategy to increase the number of tradable cryptocurrencies. India: OKX plans to enter India and recruit local staff. CoinSwitch lays off employees from the customer support team. Binance considers exiting the Russian market. Other News: Electricite Du Laos stops providing electricity to cryptocurrency mining operations. Uzbekistan develops regulations for cryptocurrency miner registration and mining pool operations. Turkish Lira stablecoin becomes the second-largest non-USD stablecoin. Oman invests nearly $800 million in cryptocurrency mining operations.

#Autumn is sneaking into the northern hemisphere. Do you feel it? 🍂

#HangoutwithKuCoin

extracted_news.title: Binance Futures to Cease Support for USDP as Cross Collateral, Introduces FDUSD
extracted_news.body: Starting from 17:00 on March 8, 2024, Binance Futures will support FDUSD as a joint margin asset, and will stop supporting USDP as a joint margin asset at 14:00 on March 14, 2024 (Beijing time). Due to this change, the transfer limit of USDP under the joint margin mode has been updated to zero. After 14:00 on March 14, 2024, any remaining USDP balance in the U-based contract wallet will be automatically converted to USDT at a ratio of 1:1, which may take approximately 24 hours and may not be displayed in the transaction history.

detailed_analysis.title: Asia's weekly TOP10 crypto news (Aug 28 to Sep 3)
detailed_analysis.body: China: An article published in the People's Court Daily argues that virtual currencies should be recognized as legitimate assets and protected unless used for illegal activities. In a separate case, a court in Wuhan declared a virtual currency mining contract invalid. Hong Kong: HashKey Exchange opens retail trading and plans to introduce HKD trading pairs in the future. SEBA Bank receives preliminary approval from the SFC to engage in securities trading. ZA Bank becomes the first settlement bank for HashKey Exchange. South Korea: Financial authorities will require exchanges to establish reserves to compensate users for losses. Arrest warrants for individuals involved in cryptocurrency listing bribery are rejected. Delio discloses platform deposits and estimated loss rate. Japan: The FSA releases financial policy guidelines for the 2023 fiscal year, aiming to achieve a digital society. Binance Japan announces market strategy to increase the number of tradable cryptocurrencies. India: OKX plans to enter India and recruit local staff. CoinSwitch lays off employees from the customer support team. Binance considers exiting the Russian market. Other News: Electricite Du Laos stops providing electricity to cryptocurrency mining operations. Uzbekistan develops regulations for cryptocurrency miner registration and mining pool operations. Turkish Lira stablecoin becomes the second-largest non-USD stablecoin. Oman invests nearly $800 million in cryptocurrency mining operations.

#Autumn is sneaking into the northern hemisphere. Do you feel it? 🍂

extracted_news.title: Binance Futures to Cease Support for USDP as Cross Collateral, Introduces FDUSD
extracted_news.body: Starting from 17:00 on March 8, 2024, Binance Futures will support FDUSD as a joint margin asset, and will stop supporting USDP as a joint margin asset at 14:00 on March 14, 2024 (Beijing time). Due to this change, the transfer limit of USDP under the joint margin mode has been updated to zero. After 14:00 on March 14, 2024, any remaining USDP balance in the U-based contract wallet will be automatically converted to USDT at a ratio of 1:1, which may take approximately 24 hours and may not be displayed in the transaction history.

After 14:00 on March 14, 2024, any remaining USDP balance in the U-based contract wallet will be automatically converted to USDT at a ratio of 1:1, which may take approximately 24 hours and may not be displayed in the transaction history.

detailed_analysis.title: Asia's weekly TOP10 crypto news (Aug 28 to Sep 3)
detailed_analysis.body: China: An article published in the People's Court Daily argues that virtual currencies should be recognized as legitimate assets and protected unless used for illegal activities. In a separate case, a court in Wuhan declared a virtual currency mining contract invalid. Hong Kong: HashKey Exchange opens retail trading and plans to introduce HKD trading pairs in the future. SEBA Bank receives preliminary approval from the SFC to engage in securities trading. ZA Bank becomes the first settlement bank for HashKey Exchange. South Korea: Financial authorities will require exchanges to establish reserves to compensate users for losses. Arrest warrants for individuals involved in cryptocurrency listing bribery are rejected. Delio discloses platform deposits and estimated loss rate. Japan: The FSA releases financial policy guidelines for the 2023 fiscal year, aiming to achieve a digital society. Binance Japan announces market strategy to increase the number of tradable cryptocurrencies. India: OKX plans to enter India and recruit local staff. CoinSwitch lays off employees from the customer support team. Binance considers exiting the Russian market. Other News: Electricite Du Laos stops providing electricity to cryptocurrency mining operations. Uzbekistan develops regulations for cryptocurrency miner registration and mining pool operations. Turkish Lira stablecoin becomes the second-largest non-USD stablecoin. Oman invests nearly $800 million in cryptocurrency mining operations.

extracted_news.title: Paxos Clarifies USDP Decoupling Due to Pricing Aggregator Issues
extracted_news.body: According to BlockBeats, on April 18, CoinTelegraph reported that a Paxos spokesperson said, "The recent decoupling of the stablecoin USDP was due to problems with the pricing aggregator, not the protocol itself. These platforms obtain pricing data from trading platforms. Yesterday, the price of USDP on some trading platforms fluctuated violently, affecting the price of USDP on the pricing aggregator. Paxos does not control the market or trading activities of other trading platforms." BlockBeats previously reported that USDP briefly broke through $1.5 yesterday.

detailed_analysis.title: Paxos Clarifies USDP Decoupling Due to Pricing Aggregator Issues
detailed_analysis.body: According to BlockBeats, on April 18, CoinTelegraph reported that a Paxos spokesperson said, "The recent decoupling of the stablecoin USDP was due to problems with the pricing aggregator, not the protocol itself. These platforms obtain pricing data from trading platforms. Yesterday, the price of USDP on some trading platforms fluctuated violently, affecting the price of USDP on the pricing aggregator. Paxos does not control the market or trading activities of other trading platforms." BlockBeats previously reported that USDP briefly broke through $1.5 yesterday.

detailed_analysis.title: Stablecoin USDP Experiences Volatility, Briefly Surpasses $1.5 Before Dropping to $1.12
detailed_analysis.body: On April 17, the stablecoin USDP experienced significant volatility, briefly surpassing the $1.5 mark before dropping to its current quote of $1.12, according to market data reported by BlockBeats.

detailed_analysis.title: Binance Futures to Cease Support for USDP as Cross Collateral, Introduces FDUSD
detailed_analysis.body: Starting from 17:00 on March 8, 2024, Binance Futures will support FDUSD as a joint margin asset, and will stop supporting USDP as a joint margin asset at 14:00 on March 14, 2024 (Beijing time). Due to this change, the transfer limit of USDP under the joint margin mode has been updated to zero. After 14:00 on March 14, 2024, any remaining USDP balance in the U-based contract wallet will be automatically converted to USDT at a ratio of 1:1, which may take approximately 24 hours and may not be displayed in the transaction history.

detailed_analysis.title: Asia's weekly TOP10 crypto news (Aug 28 to Sep 3)
detailed_analysis.body: China: An article published in the People's Court Daily argues that virtual currencies should be recognized as legitimate assets and protected unless used for illegal activities. In a separate case, a court in Wuhan declared a virtual currency mining contract invalid. Hong Kong: HashKey Exchange opens retail trading and plans to introduce HKD trading pairs in the future. SEBA Bank receives preliminary approval from the SFC to engage in securities trading. ZA Bank becomes the first settlement bank for HashKey Exchange. South Korea: Financial authorities will require exchanges to establish reserves to compensate users for losses. Arrest warrants for individuals involved in cryptocurrency listing bribery are rejected. Delio discloses platform deposits and estimated loss rate. Japan: The FSA releases financial policy guidelines for the 2023 fiscal year, aiming to achieve a digital society. Binance Japan announces market strategy to increase the number of tradable cryptocurrencies. India: OKX plans to enter India and recruit local staff. CoinSwitch lays off employees from the customer support team. Binance considers exiting the Russian market. Other News: Electricite Du Laos stops providing electricity to cryptocurrency mining operations. Uzbekistan develops regulations for cryptocurrency miner registration and mining pool operations. Turkish Lira stablecoin becomes the second-largest non-USD stablecoin. Oman invests nearly $800 million in cryptocurrency mining operations.

detailed_analysis.title: Paxos Clarifies USDP Decoupling Due to Pricing Aggregator Issues
detailed_analysis.body: According to BlockBeats, on April 18, CoinTelegraph reported that a Paxos spokesperson said, "The recent decoupling of the stablecoin USDP was due to problems with the pricing aggregator, not the protocol itself. These platforms obtain pricing data from trading platforms. Yesterday, the price of USDP on some trading platforms fluctuated violently, affecting the price of USDP on the pricing aggregator. Paxos does not control the market or trading activities of other trading platforms." BlockBeats previously reported that USDP briefly broke through $1.5 yesterday.

detailed_analysis.title: Stablecoin USDP Experiences Volatility, Briefly Surpasses $1.5 Before Dropping to $1.12
detailed_analysis.body: On April 17, the stablecoin USDP experienced significant volatility, briefly surpassing the $1.5 mark before dropping to its current quote of $1.12, according to market data reported by BlockBeats.

detailed_analysis.title: Binance Futures to Cease Support for USDP as Cross Collateral, Introduces FDUSD
detailed_analysis.body: Starting from 17:00 on March 8, 2024, Binance Futures will support FDUSD as a joint margin asset, and will stop supporting USDP as a joint margin asset at 14:00 on March 14, 2024 (Beijing time). Due to this change, the transfer limit of USDP under the joint margin mode has been updated to zero. After 14:00 on March 14, 2024, any remaining USDP balance in the U-based contract wallet will be automatically converted to USDT at a ratio of 1:1, which may take approximately 24 hours and may not be displayed in the transaction history.

detailed_analysis.title: Asia's weekly TOP10 crypto news (Aug 28 to Sep 3)
detailed_analysis.body: China: An article published in the People's Court Daily argues that virtual currencies should be recognized as legitimate assets and protected unless used for illegal activities. In a separate case, a court in Wuhan declared a virtual currency mining contract invalid. Hong Kong: HashKey Exchange opens retail trading and plans to introduce HKD trading pairs in the future. SEBA Bank receives preliminary approval from the SFC to engage in securities trading. ZA Bank becomes the first settlement bank for HashKey Exchange. South Korea: Financial authorities will require exchanges to establish reserves to compensate users for losses. Arrest warrants for individuals involved in cryptocurrency listing bribery are rejected. Delio discloses platform deposits and estimated loss rate. Japan: The FSA releases financial policy guidelines for the 2023 fiscal year, aiming to achieve a digital society. Binance Japan announces market strategy to increase the number of tradable cryptocurrencies. India: OKX plans to enter India and recruit local staff. CoinSwitch lays off employees from the customer support team. Binance considers exiting the Russian market. Other News: Electricite Du Laos stops providing electricity to cryptocurrency mining operations. Uzbekistan develops regulations for cryptocurrency miner registration and mining pool operations. Turkish Lira stablecoin becomes the second-largest non-USD stablecoin. Oman invests nearly $800 million in cryptocurrency mining operations.

detailed_analysis.title: Paxos Clarifies USDP Decoupling Due to Pricing Aggregator Issues
detailed_analysis.body: According to BlockBeats, on April 18, CoinTelegraph reported that a Paxos spokesperson said, "The recent decoupling of the stablecoin USDP was due to problems with the pricing aggregator, not the protocol itself. These platforms obtain pricing data from trading platforms. Yesterday, the price of USDP on some trading platforms fluctuated violently, affecting the price of USDP on the pricing aggregator. Paxos does not control the market or trading activities of other trading platforms." BlockBeats previously reported that USDP briefly broke through $1.5 yesterday.

detailed_analysis.title: Stablecoin USDP Experiences Volatility, Briefly Surpasses $1.5 Before Dropping to $1.12
detailed_analysis.body: On April 17, the stablecoin USDP experienced significant volatility, briefly surpassing the $1.5 mark before dropping to its current quote of $1.12, according to market data reported by BlockBeats.

detailed_analysis.title: Binance Futures to Cease Support for USDP as Cross Collateral, Introduces FDUSD
detailed_analysis.body: Starting from 17:00 on March 8, 2024, Binance Futures will support FDUSD as a joint margin asset, and will stop supporting USDP as a joint margin asset at 14:00 on March 14, 2024 (Beijing time). Due to this change, the transfer limit of USDP under the joint margin mode has been updated to zero. After 14:00 on March 14, 2024, any remaining USDP balance in the U-based contract wallet will be automatically converted to USDT at a ratio of 1:1, which may take approximately 24 hours and may not be displayed in the transaction history.

detailed_analysis.title: Don’t let DeFi collapse on shaky foundations
detailed_analysis.body: Opinion: What we’ve built so far can be compared to a collection of shiny skyscrapers, each project adrift on its own island of liquidity.

According to SlowMist monitoring, the attackers of Bitbrowser, which is often used by airdrop hunters, have transferred 236.27 ETH to the mixer eXch, worth about 386,000 US dollars, accounting for 70.6% of the total stolen funds. Previously, Bitbrowser issued a notice saying that…

Alex, the founder of zkSync, proposed a new governance solution: L1 Fork as the Court of Final Appeal and a hierarchical system of onchain courts similar to the real-world judiciary with a standard ERC interface for it. zkSync will fund such research. Read more…

A Chinese court ruled that a Filecoin mining case violated the principles of green development and social and public interests, so the contract was invalid. At present, most civil contracts involving cryptocurrency and mining are not recognized by Chinese courts and ruled…

detailed_analysis.title: Asia's weekly TOP10 crypto news (Aug 28 to Sep 3)
detailed_analysis.body: China: An article published in the People's Court Daily argues that virtual currencies should be recognized as legitimate assets and protected unless used for illegal activities. In a separate case, a court in Wuhan declared a virtual currency mining contract invalid. Hong Kong: HashKey Exchange opens retail trading and plans to introduce HKD trading pairs in the future. SEBA Bank receives preliminary approval from the SFC to engage in securities trading. ZA Bank becomes the first settlement bank for HashKey Exchange. South Korea: Financial authorities will require exchanges to establish reserves to compensate users for losses. Arrest warrants for individuals involved in cryptocurrency listing bribery are rejected. Delio discloses platform deposits and estimated loss rate. Japan: The FSA releases financial policy guidelines for the 2023 fiscal year, aiming to achieve a digital society. Binance Japan announces market strategy to increase the number of tradable cryptocurrencies. India: OKX plans to enter India and recruit local staff. CoinSwitch lays off employees from the customer support team. Binance considers exiting the Russian market. Other News: Electricite Du Laos stops providing electricity to cryptocurrency mining operations. Uzbekistan develops regulations for cryptocurrency miner registration and mining pool operations. Turkish Lira stablecoin becomes the second-largest non-USD stablecoin. Oman invests nearly $800 million in cryptocurrency mining operations.

#Autumn is sneaking into the northern hemisphere. Do you feel it? 🍂

#HangoutwithKuCoin

Alex, the founder of zkSync, proposed a new governance solution: L1 Fork as the Court of Final Appeal and a hierarchical system of onchain courts similar to the real-world judiciary with a standard ERC interface for it. zkSync will fund such research. Read more…

A Chinese court ruled that a Filecoin mining case violated the principles of green development and social and public interests, so the contract was invalid. At present, most civil contracts involving cryptocurrency and mining are not recognized by Chinese courts and ruled…

extracted_news.title: Asia's weekly TOP10 crypto news (Aug 28 to Sep 3)
extracted_news.body: China: An article published in the People's Court Daily argues that virtual currencies should be recognized as legitimate assets and protected unless used for illegal activities. In a separate case, a court in Wuhan declared a virtual currency mining contract invalid. Hong Kong: HashKey Exchange opens retail trading and plans to introduce HKD trading pairs in the future. SEBA Bank receives preliminary approval from the SFC to engage in securities trading. ZA Bank becomes the first settlement bank for HashKey Exchange. South Korea: Financial authorities will require exchanges to establish reserves to compensate users for losses. Arrest warrants for individuals involved in cryptocurrency listing bribery are rejected. Delio discloses platform deposits and estimated loss rate. Japan: The FSA releases financial policy guidelines for the 2023 fiscal year, aiming to achieve a digital society. Binance Japan announces market strategy to increase the number of tradable cryptocurrencies. India: OKX plans to enter India and recruit local staff. CoinSwitch lays off employees from the customer support team. Binance considers exiting the Russian market. Other News: Electricite Du Laos stops providing electricity to cryptocurrency mining operations. Uzbekistan develops regulations for cryptocurrency miner registration and mining pool operations. Turkish Lira stablecoin becomes the second-largest non-USD stablecoin. Oman invests nearly $800 million in cryptocurrency mining operations.

#Autumn is sneaking into the northern hemisphere. Do you feel it? 🍂

#HangoutwithKuCoin

detailed_analysis.title: Paxos Clarifies USDP Decoupling Due to Pricing Aggregator Issues
detailed_analysis.body: According to BlockBeats, on April 18, CoinTelegraph reported that a Paxos spokesperson said, "The recent decoupling of the stablecoin USDP was due to problems with the pricing aggregator, not the protocol itself. These platforms obtain pricing data from trading platforms. Yesterday, the price of USDP on some trading platforms fluctuated violently, affecting the price of USDP on the pricing aggregator. Paxos does not control the market or trading activities of other trading platforms." BlockBeats previously reported that USDP briefly broke through $1.5 yesterday.

detailed_analysis.title: Stablecoin USDP Experiences Volatility, Briefly Surpasses $1.5 Before Dropping to $1.12
detailed_analysis.body: On April 17, the stablecoin USDP experienced significant volatility, briefly surpassing the $1.5 mark before dropping to its current quote of $1.12, according to market data reported by BlockBeats.

detailed_analysis.title: Binance Futures to Cease Support for USDP as Cross Collateral, Introduces FDUSD
detailed_analysis.body: Starting from 17:00 on March 8, 2024, Binance Futures will support FDUSD as a joint margin asset, and will stop supporting USDP as a joint margin asset at 14:00 on March 14, 2024 (Beijing time). Due to this change, the transfer limit of USDP under the joint margin mode has been updated to zero. After 14:00 on March 14, 2024, any remaining USDP balance in the U-based contract wallet will be automatically converted to USDT at a ratio of 1:1, which may take approximately 24 hours and may not be displayed in the transaction history.

detailed_analysis.body: Stablecoin issuer Paxos has announced the official launch of its stablecoin USDP on the Solana network.

extracted_news.title: Asia's weekly TOP10 crypto news (Aug 28 to Sep 3)
extracted_news.body: China: An article published in the People's Court Daily argues that virtual currencies should be recognized as legitimate assets and protected unless used for illegal activities. In a separate case, a court in Wuhan declared a virtual currency mining contract invalid. Hong Kong: HashKey Exchange opens retail trading and plans to introduce HKD trading pairs in the future. SEBA Bank receives preliminary approval from the SFC to engage in securities trading. ZA Bank becomes the first settlement bank for HashKey Exchange. South Korea: Financial authorities will require exchanges to establish reserves to compensate users for losses. Arrest warrants for individuals involved in cryptocurrency listing bribery are rejected. Delio discloses platform deposits and estimated loss rate. Japan: The FSA releases financial policy guidelines for the 2023 fiscal year, aiming to achieve a digital society. Binance Japan announces market strategy to increase the number of tradable cryptocurrencies. India: OKX plans to enter India and recruit local staff. CoinSwitch lays off employees from the customer support team. Binance considers exiting the Russian market. Other News: Electricite Du Laos stops providing electricity to cryptocurrency mining operations. Uzbekistan develops regulations for cryptocurrency miner registration and mining pool operations. Turkish Lira stablecoin becomes the second-largest non-USD stablecoin. Oman invests nearly $800 million in cryptocurrency mining operations.

#Autumn is sneaking into the northern hemisphere. Do you feel it? 🍂

#HangoutwithKuCoin

detailed_analysis.title: Paxos Clarifies USDP Decoupling Due to Pricing Aggregator Issues
detailed_analysis.body: According to BlockBeats, on April 18, CoinTelegraph reported that a Paxos spokesperson said, "The recent decoupling of the stablecoin USDP was due to problems with the pricing aggregator, not the protocol itself. These platforms obtain pricing data from trading platforms. Yesterday, the price of USDP on some trading platforms fluctuated violently, affecting the price of USDP on the pricing aggregator. Paxos does not control the market or trading activities of other trading platforms." BlockBeats previously reported that USDP briefly broke through $1.5 yesterday.

detailed_analysis.title: Stablecoin USDP Experiences Volatility, Briefly Surpasses $1.5 Before Dropping to $1.12
detailed_analysis.body: On April 17, the stablecoin USDP experienced significant volatility, briefly surpassing the $1.5 mark before dropping to its current quote of $1.12, according to market data reported by BlockBeats.

detailed_analysis.title: Binance Futures to Cease Support for USDP as Cross Collateral, Introduces FDUSD
detailed_analysis.body: Starting from 17:00 on March 8, 2024, Binance Futures will support FDUSD as a joint margin asset, and will stop supporting USDP as a joint margin asset at 14:00 on March 14, 2024 (Beijing time). Due to this change, the transfer limit of USDP under the joint margin mode has been updated to zero. After 14:00 on March 14, 2024, any remaining USDP balance in the U-based contract wallet will be automatically converted to USDT at a ratio of 1:1, which may take approximately 24 hours and may not be displayed in the transaction history.

detailed_analysis.title: Paxos Launches Stablecoin USDP on Solana Network
detailed_analysis.body: Stablecoin issuer Paxos has announced the official launch of its stablecoin USDP on the Solana network.

extracted_news.title: Paxos Clarifies USDP Decoupling Due to Pricing Aggregator Issues
extracted_news.body: According to BlockBeats, on April 18, CoinTelegraph reported that a Paxos spokesperson said, "The recent decoupling of the stablecoin USDP was due to problems with the pricing aggregator, not the protocol itself. These platforms obtain pricing data from trading platforms. Yesterday, the price of USDP on some trading platforms fluctuated violently, affecting the price of USDP on the pricing aggregator. Paxos does not control the market or trading activities of other trading platforms." BlockBeats previously reported that USDP briefly broke through $1.5 yesterday.

extracted_news.title: Stablecoin USDP Experiences Volatility, Briefly Surpasses $1.5 Before Dropping to $1.12
extracted_news.body: On April 17, the stablecoin USDP experienced significant volatility, briefly surpassing the $1.5 mark before dropping to its current quote of $1.12, according to market data reported by BlockBeats.

extracted_news.title: Binance Futures to Cease Support for USDP as Cross Collateral, Introduces FDUSD
extracted_news.body: Starting from 17:00 on March 8, 2024, Binance Futures will support FDUSD as a joint margin asset, and will stop supporting USDP as a joint margin asset at 14:00 on March 14, 2024 (Beijing time). Due to this change, the transfer limit of USDP under the joint margin mode has been updated to zero. After 14:00 on March 14, 2024, any remaining USDP balance in the U-based contract wallet will be automatically converted to USDT at a ratio of 1:1, which may take approximately 24 hours and may not be displayed in the transaction history.

extracted_news.title: Paxos Launches Stablecoin USDP on Solana Network
extracted_news.body: Stablecoin issuer Paxos has announced the official launch of its stablecoin USDP on the Solana network.

extracted_news.title: Asia's weekly TOP10 crypto news (Aug 28 to Sep 3)
extracted_news.body: China: An article published in the People's Court Daily argues that virtual currencies should be recognized as legitimate assets and protected unless used for illegal activities. In a separate case, a court in Wuhan declared a virtual currency mining contract invalid. Hong Kong: HashKey Exchange opens retail trading and plans to introduce HKD trading pairs in the future. SEBA Bank receives preliminary approval from the SFC to engage in securities trading. ZA Bank becomes the first settlement bank for HashKey Exchange. South Korea: Financial authorities will require exchanges to establish reserves to compensate users for losses. Arrest warrants for individuals involved in cryptocurrency listing bribery are rejected. Delio discloses platform deposits and estimated loss rate. Japan: The FSA releases financial policy guidelines for the 2023 fiscal year, aiming to achieve a digital society. Binance Japan announces market strategy to increase the number of tradable cryptocurrencies. India: OKX plans to enter India and recruit local staff. CoinSwitch lays off employees from the customer support team. Binance considers exiting the Russian market. Other News: Electricite Du Laos stops providing electricity to cryptocurrency mining operations. Uzbekistan develops regulations for cryptocurrency miner registration and mining pool operations. Turkish Lira stablecoin becomes the second-largest non-USD stablecoin. Oman invests nearly $800 million in cryptocurrency mining operations.

#Autumn is sneaking into the northern hemisphere. Do you feel it? 🍂

extracted_news.title: Paxos Clarifies USDP Decoupling Due to Pricing Aggregator Issues
extracted_news.body: According to BlockBeats, on April 18, CoinTelegraph reported that a Paxos spokesperson said, "The recent decoupling of the stablecoin USDP was due to problems with the pricing aggregator, not the protocol itself. These platforms obtain pricing data from trading platforms. Yesterday, the price of USDP on some trading platforms fluctuated violently, affecting the price of USDP on the pricing aggregator. Paxos does not control the market or trading activities of other trading platforms." BlockBeats previously reported that USDP briefly broke through $1.5 yesterday.

extracted_news.title: Stablecoin USDP Experiences Volatility, Briefly Surpasses $1.5 Before Dropping to $1.12
extracted_news.body: On April 17, the stablecoin USDP experienced significant volatility, briefly surpassing the $1.5 mark before dropping to its current quote of $1.12, according to market data reported by BlockBeats.

extracted_news.title: Binance Futures to Cease Support for USDP as Cross Collateral, Introduces FDUSD
extracted_news.body: Starting from 17:00 on March 8, 2024, Binance Futures will support FDUSD as a joint margin asset, and will stop supporting USDP as a joint margin asset at 14:00 on March 14, 2024 (Beijing time). Due to this change, the transfer limit of USDP under the joint margin mode has been updated to zero. After 14:00 on March 14, 2024, any remaining USDP balance in the U-based contract wallet will be automatically converted to USDT at a ratio of 1:1, which may take approximately 24 hours and may not be displayed in the transaction history.

extracted_news.title: Paxos Launches Stablecoin USDP on Solana Network
extracted_news.body: Stablecoin issuer Paxos has announced the official launch of its stablecoin USDP on the Solana network.

extracted_news.title: Don’t let DeFi collapse on shaky foundations
extracted_news.body: Opinion: What we’ve built so far can be compared to a collection of shiny skyscrapers, each project adrift on its own island of liquidity.

According to SlowMist monitoring, the attackers of Bitbrowser, which is often used by airdrop hunters, have transferred 236.27 ETH to the mixer eXch, worth about 386,000 US dollars, accounting for 70.6% of the total stolen funds. Previously, Bitbrowser issued a notice saying that…

Alex, the founder of zkSync, proposed a new governance solution: L1 Fork as the Court of Final Appeal and a hierarchical system of onchain courts similar to the real-world judiciary with a standard ERC interface for it. zkSync will fund such research. Read more…

A Chinese court ruled that a Filecoin mining case violated the principles of green development and social and public interests, so the contract was invalid. At present, most civil contracts involving cryptocurrency and mining are not recognized by Chinese courts and ruled…

extracted_news.title: Asia's weekly TOP10 crypto news (Aug 28 to Sep 3)
extracted_news.body: China: An article published in the People's Court Daily argues that virtual currencies should be recognized as legitimate assets and protected unless used for illegal activities. In a separate case, a court in Wuhan declared a virtual currency mining contract invalid. Hong Kong: HashKey Exchange opens retail trading and plans to introduce HKD trading pairs in the future. SEBA Bank receives preliminary approval from the SFC to engage in securities trading. ZA Bank becomes the first settlement bank for HashKey Exchange. South Korea: Financial authorities will require exchanges to establish reserves to compensate users for losses. Arrest warrants for individuals involved in cryptocurrency listing bribery are rejected. Delio discloses platform deposits and estimated loss rate. Japan: The FSA releases financial policy guidelines for the 2023 fiscal year, aiming to achieve a digital society. Binance Japan announces market strategy to increase the number of tradable cryptocurrencies. India: OKX plans to enter India and recruit local staff. CoinSwitch lays off employees from the customer support team. Binance considers exiting the Russian market. Other News: Electricite Du Laos stops providing electricity to cryptocurrency mining operations. Uzbekistan develops regulations for cryptocurrency miner registration and mining pool operations. Turkish Lira stablecoin becomes the second-largest non-USD stablecoin. Oman invests nearly $800 million in cryptocurrency mining operations.

#Autumn is sneaking into the northern hemisphere. Do you feel it? 🍂

#HangoutwithKuCoin

extracted_news.title: Paxos Clarifies USDP Decoupling Due to Pricing Aggregator Issues
extracted_news.body: According to BlockBeats, on April 18, CoinTelegraph reported that a Paxos spokesperson said, "The recent decoupling of the stablecoin USDP was due to problems with the pricing aggregator, not the protocol itself. These platforms obtain pricing data from trading platforms. Yesterday, the price of USDP on some trading platforms fluctuated violently, affecting the price of USDP on the pricing aggregator. Paxos does not control the market or trading activities of other trading platforms." BlockBeats previously reported that USDP briefly broke through $1.5 yesterday.

extracted_news.title: Stablecoin USDP Experiences Volatility, Briefly Surpasses $1.5 Before Dropping to $1.12
extracted_news.body: On April 17, the stablecoin USDP experienced significant volatility, briefly surpassing the $1.5 mark before dropping to its current quote of $1.12, according to market data reported by BlockBeats.

extracted_news.title: Binance Futures to Cease Support for USDP as Cross Collateral, Introduces FDUSD
extracted_news.body: Starting from 17:00 on March 8, 2024, Binance Futures will support FDUSD as a joint margin asset, and will stop supporting USDP as a joint margin asset at 14:00 on March 14, 2024 (Beijing time). Due to this change, the transfer limit of USDP under the joint margin mode has been updated to zero. After 14:00 on March 14, 2024, any remaining USDP balance in the U-based contract wallet will be automatically converted to USDT at a ratio of 1:1, which may take approximately 24 hours and may not be displayed in the transaction history.

extracted_news.body: Stablecoin issuer Paxos has announced the official launch of its stablecoin USDP on the Solana network.

extracted_news.title: Asia's weekly TOP10 crypto news (Aug 28 to Sep 3)
extracted_news.body: China: An article published in the People's Court Daily argues that virtual currencies should be recognized as legitimate assets and protected unless used for illegal activities. In a separate case, a court in Wuhan declared a virtual currency mining contract invalid. Hong Kong: HashKey Exchange opens retail trading and plans to introduce HKD trading pairs in the future. SEBA Bank receives preliminary approval from the SFC to engage in securities trading. ZA Bank becomes the first settlement bank for HashKey Exchange. South Korea: Financial authorities will require exchanges to establish reserves to compensate users for losses. Arrest warrants for individuals involved in cryptocurrency listing bribery are rejected. Delio discloses platform deposits and estimated loss rate. Japan: The FSA releases financial policy guidelines for the 2023 fiscal year, aiming to achieve a digital society. Binance Japan announces market strategy to increase the number of tradable cryptocurrencies. India: OKX plans to enter India and recruit local staff. CoinSwitch lays off employees from the customer support team. Binance considers exiting the Russian market. Other News: Electricite Du Laos stops providing electricity to cryptocurrency mining operations. Uzbekistan develops regulations for cryptocurrency miner registration and mining pool operations. Turkish Lira stablecoin becomes the second-largest non-USD stablecoin. Oman invests nearly $800 million in cryptocurrency mining operations.

extracted_news.title: Paxos Clarifies USDP Decoupling Due to Pricing Aggregator Issues
extracted_news.body: According to BlockBeats, on April 18, CoinTelegraph reported that a Paxos spokesperson said, "The recent decoupling of the stablecoin USDP was due to problems with the pricing aggregator, not the protocol itself. These platforms obtain pricing data from trading platforms. Yesterday, the price of USDP on some trading platforms fluctuated violently, affecting the price of USDP on the pricing aggregator. Paxos does not control the market or trading activities of other trading platforms." BlockBeats previously reported that USDP briefly broke through $1.5 yesterday.

extracted_news.title: Stablecoin USDP Experiences Volatility, Briefly Surpasses $1.5 Before Dropping to $1.12
extracted_news.body: On April 17, the stablecoin USDP experienced significant volatility, briefly surpassing the $1.5 mark before dropping to its current quote of $1.12, according to market data reported by BlockBeats.

extracted_news.title: Binance Futures to Cease Support for USDP as Cross Collateral, Introduces FDUSD
extracted_news.body: Starting from 17:00 on March 8, 2024, Binance Futures will support FDUSD as a joint margin asset, and will stop supporting USDP as a joint margin asset at 14:00 on March 14, 2024 (Beijing time). Due to this change, the transfer limit of USDP under the joint margin mode has been updated to zero. After 14:00 on March 14, 2024, any remaining USDP balance in the U-based contract wallet will be automatically converted to USDT at a ratio of 1:1, which may take approximately 24 hours and may not be displayed in the transaction history.

extracted_news.title: Asia's weekly TOP10 crypto news (Aug 28 to Sep 3)
extracted_news.body: China: An article published in the People's Court Daily argues that virtual currencies should be recognized as legitimate assets and protected unless used for illegal activities. In a separate case, a court in Wuhan declared a virtual currency mining contract invalid. Hong Kong: HashKey Exchange opens retail trading and plans to introduce HKD trading pairs in the future. SEBA Bank receives preliminary approval from the SFC to engage in securities trading. ZA Bank becomes the first settlement bank for HashKey Exchange. South Korea: Financial authorities will require exchanges to establish reserves to compensate users for losses. Arrest warrants for individuals involved in cryptocurrency listing bribery are rejected. Delio discloses platform deposits and estimated loss rate. Japan: The FSA releases financial policy guidelines for the 2023 fiscal year, aiming to achieve a digital society. Binance Japan announces market strategy to increase the number of tradable cryptocurrencies. India: OKX plans to enter India and recruit local staff. CoinSwitch lays off employees from the customer support team. Binance considers exiting the Russian market. Other News: Electricite Du Laos stops providing electricity to cryptocurrency mining operations. Uzbekistan develops regulations for cryptocurrency miner registration and mining pool operations. Turkish Lira stablecoin becomes the second-largest non-USD stablecoin. Oman invests nearly $800 million in cryptocurrency mining operations.

prompts_output.Prompt: Considering the title and body: Given the details from the news articles, explore the current regulatory challenges facing usdp and other stablecoins. There are no indications of emerging trends, new developments, controversies, or milestones, which could imply a period of stability or a lack of innovation, depending on the broader industry context. extracted_news.title: Paxos Clarifies USDP Decoupling Due to Pricing Aggregator Issues
extracted_news.body: According to BlockBeats, on April 18, CoinTelegraph reported that a Paxos spokesperson said, "The recent decoupling of the stablecoin USDP was due to problems with the pricing aggregator, not the protocol itself. These platforms obtain pricing data from trading platforms. Yesterday, the price of USDP on some trading platforms fluctuated violently, affecting the price of USDP on the pricing aggregator. Paxos does not control the market or trading activities of other trading platforms." BlockBeats previously reported that USDP briefly broke through $1.5 yesterday.

extracted_news.title: Stablecoin USDP Experiences Volatility, Briefly Surpasses $1.5 Before Dropping to $1.12
extracted_news.body: On April 17, the stablecoin USDP experienced significant volatility, briefly surpassing the $1.5 mark before dropping to its current quote of $1.12, according to market data reported by BlockBeats.

extracted_news.title: Binance Futures to Cease Support for USDP as Cross Collateral, Introduces FDUSD
extracted_news.body: Starting from 17:00 on March 8, 2024, Binance Futures will support FDUSD as a joint margin asset, and will stop supporting USDP as a joint margin asset at 14:00 on March 14, 2024 (Beijing time). Due to this change, the transfer limit of USDP under the joint margin mode has been updated to zero. After 14:00 on March 14, 2024, any remaining USDP balance in the U-based contract wallet will be automatically converted to USDT at a ratio of 1:1, which may take approximately 24 hours and may not be displayed in the transaction history.

extracted_news.body: Stablecoin issuer Paxos has announced the official launch of its stablecoin USDP on the Solana network.

Alex, the founder of zkSync, proposed a new governance solution: L1 Fork as the Court of Final Appeal and a hierarchical system of onchain courts similar to the real-world judiciary with a standard ERC interface for it. zkSync will fund such research. Read more…

extracted_news.title: Asia's weekly TOP10 crypto news (Aug 28 to Sep 3)
extracted_news.body: China: An article published in the People's Court Daily argues that virtual currencies should be recognized as legitimate assets and protected unless used for illegal activities. In a separate case, a court in Wuhan declared a virtual currency mining contract invalid. Hong Kong: HashKey Exchange opens retail trading and plans to introduce HKD trading pairs in the future. SEBA Bank receives preliminary approval from the SFC to engage in securities trading. ZA Bank becomes the first settlement bank for HashKey Exchange. South Korea: Financial authorities will require exchanges to establish reserves to compensate users for losses. Arrest warrants for individuals involved in cryptocurrency listing bribery are rejected. Delio discloses platform deposits and estimated loss rate. Japan: The FSA releases financial policy guidelines for the 2023 fiscal year, aiming to achieve a digital society. Binance Japan announces market strategy to increase the number of tradable cryptocurrencies. India: OKX plans to enter India and recruit local staff. CoinSwitch lays off employees from the customer support team. Binance considers exiting the Russian market. Other News: Electricite Du Laos stops providing electricity to cryptocurrency mining operations. Uzbekistan develops regulations for cryptocurrency miner registration and mining pool operations. Turkish Lira stablecoin becomes the second-largest non-USD stablecoin. Oman invests nearly $800 million in cryptocurrency mining operations.

#Autumn is sneaking into the northern hemisphere. Do you feel it? 🍂

In a separate case, a court in Wuhan declared a virtual currency mining contract invalid. Hong Kong: HashKey Exchange opens retail trading and plans to introduce HKD trading pairs in the future. SEBA Bank receives preliminary approval from the SFC to engage in securities trading. ZA Bank becomes the first settlement bank for HashKey Exchange. South Korea: Financial authorities will require exchanges to establish reserves to compensate users for losses. Arrest warrants for individuals involved in cryptocurrency listing bribery are rejected. Delio discloses platform deposits and estimated loss rate. Japan: The FSA releases financial policy guidelines for the 2023 fiscal year, aiming to achieve a digital society. Binance Japan announces market strategy to increase the number of tradable cryptocurrencies. India: OKX plans to enter India and recruit local staff. CoinSwitch lays off employees from the customer support team. Binance considers exiting the Russian market. Other News: Electricite Du Laos stops providing electricity to cryptocurrency mining operations. Uzbekistan develops regulations for cryptocurrency miner registration and mining pool operations. Turkish Lira stablecoin becomes the second-largest non-USD stablecoin. Oman invests nearly $800 million in cryptocurrency mining operations.

prompts_output.Prompt: Considering the title and body: Analyze the expansion of usdp across multiple blockchains as described in the news articles. prompts_output.Output: I don't have the specific details from news articles regarding current regulatory challenges facing USDP and other stablecoins, nor any mentioned regulatory responses or concerns. Therefore, I cannot predict how future regulatory developments could shape the stablecoin market.

prompts_output.Prompt: Considering the title and body: Examine the issuance of billions of usdp on various networks as detailed in the articles. Identify and analyze the risks associated with such large-scale issuances for investors and the cryptocurrency market as a whole. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: Large-scale USDT issuance risks oversupply and trust erosion in Tether's reserves, potentially destabilizing its USD peg and triggering broader crypto market liquidity issues and investor confidence loss. Security concerns and compliance trends may also affect future stability and investor protection.

prompts_output.category: Competitive Analysis in the Stablecoin Market

prompts_output.Output: USDP, compared to USDC, may lag in market cap growth and transaction usage, where USDC's "Strong" rating and surpassing USDT in transactions indicate a competitive edge. However, USDP's new trading pairs could enhance its market presence, despite lacking specific details on its blockchain expansions.

prompts_output.Prompt: Considering the title and body: Based on the articles, analyze the implications of usdp's market cap exceeding $100 billion and its integration into various blockchain ecosystems. prompts_output.Output: USDT's $100 billion market cap and multi-blockchain integration suggest high liquidity and stability, offering investors a widely-accepted asset with growth potential despite regulatory challenges.

prompts_output.Prompt: Considering the title and body: Discuss the significance of usdp's expansion onto new blockchains and partnerships with platforms like Celo, as mentioned in the articles. Analyze how these collaborations could drive ecosystem growth and enhance usdp's utility. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: Tether's expansion onto new blockchains and partnerships, like with Celo, increases USDT's accessibility, fostering ecosystem growth and enhancing its utility as a bridge between traditional and decentralized finance, potentially improving liquidity and transaction efficiency.

prompts_output.Prompt: Considering the title and body: Review the instances of usdp issuance and blockchain integrations. Evaluate the security measures in place and the potential risks of blockchain disruptions, as well as the effectiveness of recovery tools for transferring usdp. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: USDP's issuance on Solana leverages high-performance infrastructure, potentially enhancing security and scalability. However, blockchain disruptions remain a risk, and the effectiveness of recovery tools for USDP transfers is uncertain without specific protocol details. Compliance trends may shape future security enhancements.

prompts_output.Prompt: Considering the title and body: Analyze the market sentiment towards usdp, considering the news of reaching a $100 billion market cap and the launch of recovery tools. Discuss how this sentiment could influence investor behavior and the overall market for stablecoins. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: Positive sentiment towards USDP is likely enhanced by reaching a $100 billion market cap and the launch of new recovery tools, which could boost investor confidence and foster growth in the stablecoin market.

prompts_output.Prompt: Considering the title and body: Consider the technological advancements and innovations surrounding usdp, including its blockchain recovery tools and expansions. Discuss the potential future developments and how they might affect the adoption and utility of usdp. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: Advancements in blockchain recovery tools and expansions could bolster USDP's security and scalability, potentially increasing its adoption and utility as a trusted stablecoin for transactions and services.

prompts_output.Prompt: Considering the title and body: Using the insights from the news articles, discuss the global impact of usdp's expansion and adoption trends. Analyze the role of usdp in facilitating cross-border payments, remittances, and its potential to drive financial inclusion. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: USDP's expansion enhances global financial inclusion by providing stable digital currency for cross-border payments and remittances, especially benefiting unbanked populations, and streamlining international transactions independent of traditional banking systems.

overall_prompt_summary: The analysis of the posts indicates a focus on legitimate business activities within the cryptocurrency sector, emphasizing innovation, adoption, and education. Key themes include the expansion of stablecoins, advancements in artificial intelligence within the crypto space, and initiatives aimed at educating the public about cryptocurrencies. There is a notable absence of discussion regarding regulatory measures and market predictions, suggesting a potential area for further investigation to ensure comprehensive coverage of the industry's challenges and future outlook. The posts do not exhibit signs of market manipulation tactics such as pump-and-dump schemes or Ponzi-like behavior, which is a positive indication of their legitimacy. However, for a more robust understanding of the sector's health and prospects, it would be beneficial to also consider regulatory developments and market dynamics in future analyses.
